prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Direct detection of 850um emission in Lyman alpha blobs
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: The goal of this proposal is to use ALMA to directly detect the individual LABs and confirm the presence of a submm source in each. A detection or non detection can be used to constrain the physical processes responsible for the Lyman alpha emission.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We request the standard set up for continuum observations. There are no lines available so we will use the full band width.

We request an angular resolution of 1.0 arcsec and a largest angular scale of 2.0 arcsec. Our chosen angular resolution is based on the ultraviolet HST morphology of those LABs that have a uv continuum counterpart. The rest frame uv morphologies suggest that the sources are on scales of ~1 arcsec.

We have requested an RMS of 0.08mJy to give a 5 sigma detection for the majority of the LABs in our sample. This is based on the SCUBA2 mean flux density of 0.8+/-0.2mJy and the assumption that most of the LABs will lie within 2 sigma of the mean value. This sensitivity will also allow us to place meaningful constraints on the underlying physical processes in the case of a non detection.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Lyman alpha blobs (LABs) offer a unique insight into the complex interface between galaxies and their surrounding environments. Whilst some LABs have been found to contain luminous star forming galaxies that could fuel the Lyman alpha emission by photon leakage, others have so far revealed no such sources. It is speculated that LABs may be powered by cold gas streaming on to a central galaxy, providing an opportunity to directly observe the cold accretion mode of star formation. Star forming galaxies in LABs could be dust obscured and therefore detectable only in longer wavelengths. We have stacked SCUBA-2 observations to determine the average 850microm flux density of the 35 LABs in the SSA22 protocluster at z~3. SCUBA2 does not have the sensitivity to detect the fainter sources individually. The goal of this proposal is to use ALMA to directly detect the individual LABs and confirm the presence of a submm source in each.A sensitivity of 0.04mJy will give a 5 sigma detection at 2 sigma below the mean SCUBA2 flux density. A non detection will rule out both star formation processes and cold accretion as individually responsible for the observed Lyman alpha luminosity.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
